competitive_intel:
## Available Competitive Intelligence

- Competition description: `../research/description.md`
- 5 top kernel notebooks in `../research/kernels/`

data_findings.finding: This is a 2D polygon packing optimization problem. Goal: pack 1-200 Christmas tree toys into smallest square bounding box. Score = sum(s_n^2/n) for n=1 to 200. Target: 68.894234. Best achieved: ~70.647. Tree shape: 15-vertex polygon with trunk, 3-tier branches. Key approaches: (1) Simulated Annealing with fractional translation, (2) Tessellation/lattice for large N, (3) Backward propagation from N=200 to N=1, (4) High-precision Decimal arithmetic.

Key kernels: (1) bbox3.cpp - C++ optimizer with complex number geometry, global squeeze, overlap repair; (2) sa_v1_parallel - simulated annealing with fractional translation steps [0.001, 0.0005, 0.0002, 0.0001, 0.00005, 0.00002, 0.00001]; (3) tree_packer_v18/v21 - tree packing optimizers; (4) Tessellation approach for large N (72, 100, 110, 144, 156, 196, 200) using 2 base trees translated in grid pattern.
